Daniel Palin
Projects About
Autonomous SLAM Robot with LiDAR and 2-Wheel Drive

A custom-built autonomous robot that uses SLAM (Simultaneous Localization and Mapping) and LiDAR to navigate and map its environment. The robot is a 2-wheel differential drive system running on ROS 2, with real-time mapping and basic autonomous navigation functionality.

ROS 2Arduino NanoRaspberry Pi 53D PrintingGazebo
Blackjack Solver using Deep Q-Learning

This project implements both Q-learning and Deep Q-Learning (DQN) algorithms to train agents to play Blackjack using environments from Gymnasium (OpenAI's Gym fork). The goal is to develop an agent that can beat the house and consistently win games using reinforcement learning.

PyTorchPythonNeural NetworksOpenAI GymDeep LearningQ-Learning
Four-Leaf Clover Classifier (ResNet18 + PyTorch)

This project is a deep learning image classifier designed to distinguish between 3-leaf and 4-leaf white clovers using a self-collected dataset and a ResNet18 architecture. It demonstrates how data augmentation and transfer learning can be used to train models on small, real-world datasets.

PyTorchOpenCVPythonCNNsMachine Learning
Cracked Concrete Classifier (ResNet18 + PyTorch)

This project is a deep learning model that classifies cracked and uncracked concrete images using a ResNet-based architecture. It leverages an open dataset to achieve high classification accuracy.

Machine LearningPyTorchPythonNeural Networks
Rainfall Prediction using Machine Learning

This project predicts rainfall using machine learning models trained on weather data from the Australian Bureau of Meteorology. The pipeline includes preprocessing, feature selection, and model training.

Scikit learnPythonMachine Learning
